result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

4:00 PM Cases called: 22CF899 & 22CM679. Defendant Owen J James in court.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak in court for Owen J James. Attorney Andrew Gunderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This is the date and time set for an arraignment in these cases. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Defendant waives reading of Information in these cases and enters Not Guilty pleas. 
Defense received an offer today and would like time to discuss that offer with his client. 

Status Conference: 12/08/22 at 10am in person for 30 min

Conditions: 
No contact with C.C., B.C.

(Cases 22CF899, 22CM679 are called at 2:30 PM) Defendant Owen J James in court with Attorney Andrew T Knaak.  Attorney Tiffany Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
22CM679- Defense waives reading of the complaint. Defendant updates phone number and address. 
22CF899- State calls Officer Greggory Erickson, Eau Claire Police Department, sworn and testifies. Cross-examination of Officer Erickson. Witness excused. State requests bind over. 
Court finds bind over and probable cause found. 
Arraignment in 22CF899 and Hearing in 22CM679 to be scheduled with Branch 3 Judicial Assistant.
